title: Victoria Beckham ditches YouTube channel as it only brings in £25 a day
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Victoria Beckham has axed her YouTube channel that showed off her glamorous lifestyle as it made her just £25 a day.

The former Spice Girl stopped making her envious videos as the high cost that comes with making them has led to whopping five-figure losses, so she's decided to call it a day, according to The Mail on Sunday .

The 45-year-old tried to utilise her channel as a platform for fashion fans and makeup lovers, showcasing her luxury life to promote "the real me" - including family scenes and inside her big label fashion range.

But Victoria has said goodbye to her channel which launched in April earlier this year, as she struggled to make money from the move.

(Image: Youtube)

(Image: Youtube)

The channel boasted 109,000 subscribers, but David Beckham's wife has turned to concentrate on other parts of her business instead.

It has been reported that her flagship store in Mayfair, London, is struggling.

Last year, Posh axed 60 staff from her business, following pressure from investors, and now staff are fearful more redundancies will be made.

Despite this, her team are are facing "horrendous" financial results this year too.

(Image: Youtube)

(Image: Dave Benett/Getty Images for Hug)

A source close to Posh revealed: "The YouTube channel has been impossible to monetise, and it was very time-consuming so the decision was that it would be pulled.

The source added that production costs were not being covered by the channel's income, so while she enjoyed making videos, it had to be pulled to benefit Victoria's business.

(Image: Instagram)

Some of her fancy videos included her showing off a messy hotel room, saying that hubby David would have "a panic attack" from the state of the room.

The fashion designer has also shared her top beauty tips, as well as promoting brands on her videos, including a £120 bottle of tequila.

And the final episode on her channel was filmed at London Fashion Week around three weeks ago.

Mirror Online has contacted Victoria's reps for comment.
description: The business mogul ditched her YouTube channel as it wasn't bringing in enough money
authors: Dave Benett Getty Images For Hug
